Hello,

I am new to Junit, I'm starting with Junit 4.
I wanted to define a=
n abstract base class
establishing required steps for a test, but I 
see th=
at methods defined in subclasses don't know what annotations
are attached t=
o corresponding signatures in a parent class.
(only class level annotation =
inheritance)

I wanted something like:
public abstract class ApiTestBase
{
=
  @BeforeClass abstract void suiteSetup() throws Exception;
  @Before abstr=
act void preTest() throws Exception;
  @Test abstract void Run() throws Exc=
eption;
  @After abstract void postTest() throws Exception;
  @AfterClass a=
bstract void suiteTearDown() throws Exception;
}
so that the subclass would=
 just have to implement the
required methods without having to explicitly r=
e-annotate.

Is there a workaround?

-E.S.
